name: Neo-Pacific Sprawl

overview.tone: Tragic Noir. Rain-soaked streets, neon reflections, corporate shadows.

geography.upperCity: Corporate towers, clean air, security drones. The wealthy live here. Access requires corporate citizenship or a very good fake ID.
geography.midCity: The working class. Factories, housing blocks, street markets. Most people live their entire lives here.
geography.underCity: The forgotten. Abandoned infrastructure, black markets, gang territories. No corporate oversight - and no corporate protection.
geography.exclusionZones: Contaminated or abandoned areas. Officially off-limits. Home to squatters, scavengers, and things best left undisturbed.

megacorps.name: Omni-Global
megacorps.reputation: The 'clean' corporation. Owns the water, the power, the roads. Quietly ruthless.

megacorps.name: Bio-Dyne
megacorps.reputation: Pioneers of human enhancement. Dark history of unethical experiments. Officially 'reformed'.

megacorps.name: Nexus Security
megacorps.focus: Private military, corporate security, law enforcement contracts
megacorps.reputation: The boot on the Sprawl's neck. Professional, brutal, everywhere.

megacorps.name: Horizon Digital
megacorps.reputation: Controls the Net. Knows everything about everyone. Sells that data to the highest bidder.

streetLevel.name: Fixers
streetLevel.description: Information brokers and job arrangers. They connect people who need things done with people who do things.

streetLevel.name: Edgerunners
streetLevel.description: Freelance operatives. Hackers, mercenaries, thieves. They take the jobs corporations won't officially sanction.

streetLevel.name: Rippers
streetLevel.description: Street surgeons. Install cyberware, patch up bullet wounds, ask no questions.

streetLevel.name: Gangs
streetLevel.description: Territorial groups controlling underCity blocks. Some are organized crime, some are community defense, most are both.

cyberware.risks: Cyberpsychosis - too much chrome can erode empathy and humanity. The body rejects what the mind cannot accept.

theNet.description: Global digital network. Visualized as a 3D space when accessed via neural interface.
theNet.netrunning: Skilled hackers 'run' the Net, breaking through corporate ICE (Intrusion Countermeasures Electronics) to steal data or sabotage systems.
theNet.dangers: Black ICE can fry a netrunner's brain. Corporate countermeasures are lethal.

biotech.applications: Designer drugs, custom organs, enhanced humans.
biotech.ethics: Officially regulated. Unofficially, anything goes if you have the credits.

special.name: The Lattice (Bio-Dyne Marker)
special.description: A microscopic, honeycomb mesh woven into the iris structure of Project Heirloom subjects. Invisible to the naked eye. Visible only via high-end optic scanners (like a Netrunner's HUD) when zoomed 10x.
special.significance: Designed for automated doors to track subjects without unsightly tattoos.

economy.currency: Credits (universal digital currency) and Scrip (corporate-specific tokens)
economy.employment: Most people work for corporations. Freelancers operate in legal grey zones.
economy.blackMarket: Thriving trade in stolen data, illegal cyberware, unlicensed biotech, and corporate secrets.

dailyLife.housing: Corporate dormitories, coffin hotels, or street-level apartments. Privacy is a luxury.

beverages.rare: Bio-Dyne Pure - A discontinued brand of bottled water found in the Oakhaven ruins. The plastic is brittle and yellowed. It contained the chemical stabilizer required for Heirloom subjects.

dailyLife.entertainment: Virtual reality, braindance recordings (experience someone else's memories), underground clubs.
dailyLife.healthcare: Corporate clinics for citizens. Street rippers for everyone else.

law.enforcement: Nexus Security holds most law enforcement contracts. Corporate citizens get protection. Everyone else gets whatever they can afford.
law.justice: Corporate tribunals for corporate matters. Street justice for street matters.
law.rights: Officially, everyone has rights. Practically, rights cost money.

slang.flatline: To die (from the sound of a heart monitor)
slang.jack in: Connect to the Net via neural interface
slang.netrunner: Hacker who operates in the Net

gmNotes: This setting is designed for noir storytelling. The world is corrupt, the powerful are untouchable, and individual actions rarely change the system - but they can change individual lives. Focus on personal stakes, moral compromises, and the human cost of survival in an inhuman world.
